item.title: How to organize a ceremony
item.author: jean.terracommuni@wecena.com (Jean Millerat)
item.description: How to organize a ceremony? In order to organize a ceremony that meets all the criteria, here is a suggested method that you can follow step by step. You can do with any other method as long as your ceremonies complies with the criteria of the guide. Choosing the ceremony venue Participants can be welcomed in a first location (e.g. a meeting room) to explain the ceremony and allow them to prepare their paper.

item.title: Protocol guide
item.author: jean.terracommuni@wecena.com (Jean Millerat)
item.description: version 0.3, English translation Introduction The aim of the TerraCommuni protocol is to enable anyone on the planet, even without an Internet connection, to prove that they wished, at a specific time and place, to be sent digital messages to the messaging ID of their choice. Put another way, the TerraCommuni protocol allows anyone to say “I’m present here and now, and I can be contacted at this phone number or e-mail address”.

item.title: About us
item.author: jean.terracommuni@wecena.com (Jean Millerat)
item.description: TerraCommuni is a free and open source data initiative by the Agence Francaise de Developpement (AFD). It is lead and maintained by Jean Millerat on behalf of the AFD.

item.title: Add a new ceremony
item.author: jean.terracommuni@wecena.com (Jean Millerat)
item.description: Copy the handwritten information from the ceremony papersheet. Date and local time from the ceremony sheet Identifier of the organizer from the ceremony sheet Location from the ceremony sheet Latitude: Longitude: Ethereum block from the ceremony sheet Block number: Block hash: Pictures and videos from the ceremony Pictures: Videos:
